properties.comments: Contact us at 308-365-0383. Certified SBA Lender and is now taking applications for the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). Call your local branch and speak with a lender or apply online https://wsb.bank/sba-ppp/. Our lobbies are open 9am - 5 pm, M-F by appointment only. Drive-thru at our Mulberry Branch is open from 7:30am -5:30pm, M-F. North College Branch drive-thru is open from 8am - 5:30pm. Please use our online banking, mobile app, drive-thru, night-drop, and ATM's for self-service banking and 24/7 account access. From these digital resources, you can make payments, deposits, transfers, view transactions, and more. Money Pass ATM's are free to our customers and you may find a list of all Money Pass ATM's in the community at: https://www.moneypass.com/atm-locator.html. Every device is sterilized before and after your repair.  We even sanitize your device with UV light after the repair to ensure your safety. We only allow one customer at a time into the store.  We disinfect and sanitize after every customer; and every night before we close, we disinfect and sanitize the entire store. We can check you in at the curbside to ensure appropriate social distancing precautions are taken. We can even come to your residence or place of business to pick up devices and will happily bring them back to you after the repair is completed.  And, we gladly accept mail-ins too. Please call the store 970-226-8652 to let us know how we can keep you in touch with your world.

properties.name: Heart & Soul Transport
properties.comments: Contact us at 970-690-3338. We are dedicated to keeping our riders, employees and the community as safe as possible. We started using PPE on March 13th and continue to use n95 masks while a rider is in the vehicle and a cloth or surgical mask when only the driver is in the vehicle. We are cleaning and disinfecting vehicles before every shift and after every shift. Drivers also disinfect after every rider. All rides are for individual riders. (Unless assistant is medically needed) All riders are required to wear either a cloth mask or better. Each rider is given 3-4 spritzes of hand sanitizer before entering the vehicle. We are in the process of installing plastic shielding separating riders and drivers to add another layer of safety. We have reduced our rides but we are still providing rides to essential medical appointments. We also have free food and medication delivery for folks over 60 in Larimer county

properties.name: Graham's Flooring and Design
properties.comments: Contact us at 970-528-5139. Showroom open by appointment only. Committed to the health and safety of our customers, employees, and installation partners. We are here and ready to provide great products and service and have put into place the following protocol: 1) Our Showroom is open by appointment only. We are sanitizing surfaces and samples between each customer visit and only allowing 1 customer (group) in at a time. Call 612-0214 for an appointment. 2) We will continue to do onsite consultations and measures with very strict adherence to the safety measures below: 3) We will respectfully keep 6 feet away from customers.  No handshakes for now - a smile and wave work great! 4) We are committed to washing hands frequently and keeping all high-touch surfaces of our office cleaned and disinfected. 5) We will disinfect doorknobs and light switches upon completion of installation.  We recommend our customers give the installers plenty of space to complete installations without crossing the 6' distance. 6) Importantly, we are closely monitoring our health. If we are not feeling well, we will contact you immediately to reschedule. We kindly ask the same of our customers.

properties.name: Harmony Smiles Dentistry
properties.comments: Contact us at 970-672-4911. During these uncertain times, we urge you to take care of yourself, which also includes seeing your healthcare providers. Our clinicians and team members remain here to assist you with your dental needs and are available to answer any questions you might have. Additional measures to further protect our patients and team members: Pre-Screening: We will communicate with you before your appointment to ask some screening questions. We will ask those same questions upon arrival for your appointment in addition to recording your temperature. If you have a cough, temperature or other symptoms consistent with COVID-19, we will kindly reschedule your appointment. Direct-To-Room: Before your appointment, you have the option to stay in your car instead of the waiting room until we are ready to seat you in your personal operatory. Simply call us upon arrival and we will let you know when we are ready for you. Protect Yourself: We encourage you to utilize our hand sanitizer, wear a mask and continue social distancing for the near term. Mouth Rinse: We could ask you to pre-rinse with peroxide which has anti-fungal, anti-bacterial and anti-viral properties. Team Member Screening: We are also screening our team members twice daily to ensure the safety of patients and team members

properties.name: Kaiser Permanente
properties.comments: All Kaiser Permanente Colorado medical offices are open. We have safety measures in place, including requiring masks at all Kaiser Permanente locations. Kaiser Permanente is committed to helping shape the future of health care. We are recognized as one of America's leading health care providers and not-for-profit health plans. Founded in 1945, our mission is to provide high-quality, affordable health care services and to improve the health of our members and the communities we serve. We serve 11.8 million members in eight states and the District of Columbia. Care for members and patients is focused on their total health and guided by their personal physicians, specialists and team of caregivers. Our expert and caring medical teams are empowered and supported by industry-leading technology advances and tools for health promotion, disease prevention, state-of-the art care delivery and world-class chronic disease management. Kaiser Permanente is dedicated to care innovations, clinical research, health education and the support of community health. For more information, go to: kp.org/share.
